process-def.name: :AutoPilot-OA-Operating_System_Utilities:Configuration:Update Boot Config Add No GUI Boot

input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
Adds the /ng option to the specified OSEntryLineNum

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Windows Server 2008"> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length('${line num}')!=0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">bcdedit /set {${line num}} quietboot on</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">bcdedit /set quietboot on</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">bootcfg /addsw /ng ${line num}</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported."</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported."</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
Adds operating system load options for a specified operating system entry.
No GUI Boot: Adds the /noguiboot option to the specified OSEntryLineNum, disabling the Windows XP Professional progress bar that appears before the CTRL+ALT+DEL logon prompt.
